thread.title: Flooding, rain chaos — and more to come
thread.title_full: Flooding, rain chaos — and more to come

title: Flooding, rain chaos — and more to come
text:
Use keywords to search content on this website Search Use keywords to search content on this website media_camera Firefighters at the corner of Parramatta Rd, Strathfield, after a car was flipped by floodwaters. Picture: Gordon McComiskie Sydney weather: Flooding, rain chaos and cold conditions — and more to come this week Keely McDonough, The Daily Telegraph February 26, 2017 8:45am 
RAIN and thunderstorms: that’s the forecast for today and the week ahead. 
Sydneysiders are waking up to a dreary Sunday morning after the city was lashed with a severe storm overnight. 
Most of Sydney and the west was hit with wild weather, causing cars to be trapped in flash flooding along main roads. media_camera Several inner west streets were flooded, including much of Strathfield that saw two cars caught in fast moving floodwater. Picture: Gordon McComiskie 
The rain was falling at a heavy rate of 10-15mm per hour as a severe weather warning was issued and drivers were urged to stay alert on the roads. 
Road signs and lines were completely shrouded by the relentless downpour in the early hours of the morning. 
Parramatta Rd and Leicester Ave at Strathfield were blocked in multiple directions as cars had become trapped in flood water that had pooled around low bends. 
Bureau of Meteorology forecaster Neale Fraser said the broader Sydney metro area copped a decent rainfall overnight. media_camera Sydney can expect more wet weather this week. Picture: Gordon McComiskie 
“The highest was Frenchs Forest that had 78mm overnight. Wahroonga had 66mm, and Allambie copped 65mm,” he said. 
“Prospect reservoir received 56mm and the city itself had 27mm. 
And the rain isn’t going to stop anytime soon. 
“It’s going to continue today. There are a lot of showers around and it will be heavy at times briefly,” Mr Fraser said. 
“There is even more showers for the rest of the week, from Monday through to Friday. 
“It’s going to be a humid week with lots of showers coming in and out with a risk of thunderstorms each day.” 
The temperature will hang around 22-24C today, and hover in the mid 20s all week.
